info.title: TWIN - Test Endpoints
info.description: REST API for TWIN - Test Endpoints.

tags.name: Auditable Item Stream
tags.description: Endpoints which are modelled to access an auditable item stream contract.

201.description: The rest request ended in created response.

400.description: The server cannot process the request, see the content for more details.

401.description: You are not authorized to use the API or no credentials were supplied, see the content for more details.

500.description: The server has encountered a situation it does not know how to handle, see the content for more details.

parameters.name: conditions
parameters.description: The conditions to filter the streams, consist of property|comparison|value comma separated.

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: The order for the results, default to created.

parameters.name: orderByDirection
parameters.description: The direction for the order, defaults to desc.

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: The properties to return as a comma separated list, defaults to "id,metadata".

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: The optional cursor to get next chunk.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The maximum number of entities in a page.

200.description: The response to getting the a list of the streams.

400.description: The server cannot process the request, see the content for more details.

401.description: You are not authorized to use the API or no credentials were supplied, see the content for more details.

404.description: The resource you tried to access does not exist, see the content for more details.

500.description: The server has encountered a situation it does not know how to handle, see the content for more details.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the stream to get.

parameters.name: includeEntries
parameters.description: Whether to include the entries, defaults to false. The entries will be limited to the first page of entries in date descending order. If you want to get more entries you can use the returned cursor with the get entries method.

parameters.name: includeDeleted
parameters.description: Whether to include deleted entries, defaults to false.

parameters.name: verifyStream
parameters.description: Should the stream be verified, defaults to false.

parameters.name: verifyEntries
parameters.description: Should the entries be verified, defaults to false.

get.summary: Get the entry objects in a stream

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the stream to get.

parameters.name: conditions
parameters.description: The conditions to filter the stream, consist of property|comparison|value comma separated.

parameters.name: includeDeleted
parameters.description: Whether to include deleted entries, defaults to false.

parameters.name: verifyEntries
parameters.description: Should the entries be verified, defaults to false.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Retrieve the entries in ascending/descending time order, defaults to Ascending.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: How many entries to return.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: Cursor to use for next chunk of data.

200.description: Response to getting an auditable item stream entries.

400.description: The server cannot process the request, see the content for more details.

401.description: You are not authorized to use the API or no credentials were supplied, see the content for more details.

404.description: The resource you tried to access does not exist, see the content for more details.

500.description: The server has encountered a situation it does not know how to handle, see the content for more details.

get.summary: Get the entry objects in a stream

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the stream to get.

parameters.name: conditions
parameters.description: The conditions to filter the stream, consist of property|comparison|value comma separated.

parameters.name: includeDeleted
parameters.description: Whether to include deleted entries, defaults to false.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Retrieve the entries in ascending/descending time order, defaults to Ascending.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: How many entries to return.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: Cursor to use for next chunk of data.

200.description: Response to getting an auditable item stream entries objects.

400.description: The server cannot process the request, see the content for more details.

401.description: You are not authorized to use the API or no credentials were supplied, see the content for more details.

404.description: The resource you tried to access does not exist, see the content for more details.

500.description: The server has encountered a situation it does not know how to handle, see the content for more details.

AuditableItemStreamCreateEntryRequest.description: The data to be used in the stream.

immutableInterval.description: After how many entries do we add immutable checks, defaults to service configured value. A value of 0 will disable immutable checks, 1 will be every item, or any other integer for an interval.

AuditableItemStreamCreateRequest.description: The data to be used in the stream.

created.description: The timestamp of when the entry was created.

updated.description: The timestamp of when the entry was updated.

deleted.description: The timestamp of when the entry was deleted, as we never actually remove items.

userIdentity.description: The identity of the user which added the entry to the stream.

entryObject.description: The object to associate with the entry as JSON-LD.

index.description: The index of the entry in the stream.

immutableStorageId.description: The immutable storage id containing the signature for the entry.

AuditableItemStreamGetEntryResponse.description: The response body, if accept header is set to application/ld+json the return object is JSON-LD document.

cursor.description: Cursor to retrieve the next chunk of data, can be used with the get entries method.

entriesVerification.description: The verification of the stream entries.

created.description: The timestamp of when the stream was created.

updated.description: The timestamp of when the stream was updated.

nodeIdentity.description: The identity of the node which controls the stream.

userIdentity.description: The identity of the user who created the stream.

metadata.description: The metadata to associate with the entry as JSON-LD.

immutableInterval.description: After how many entries do we add immutable checks.

AuditableItemStreamGetResponse.description: The response body, if accept header is set to application/ld+json the return object is JSON-LD document.

cursor.description: Cursor to retrieve the next chunk of data.

verificationEntries.description: The verification states for the entries.

AuditableItemStreamListEntriesResponse.description: The response body, if accept header is set to application/ld+json the return object is JSON-LD document.

entities.description: The entities, which can be partial if a limited keys list was provided.

cursor.description: An optional cursor, when defined can be used to call find to get more entities.

AuditableItemStreamUpdateRequest.description: The data to be used in the stream.

properties.description: Any additional information for the error.

stack.description: The stack trace for the error.

notFoundId.description: The id if the item that was not found.

properties.description: Any additional information for the error.

stack.description: The stack trace for the error.

NotFoundResponse.description: The body which contains the error.
